comments.body: So, oddly, if you clear your cache and use the existing link with the `#view` anchor it *does* bring you to the correct place on the page the first time, but not subsequent times. Using the same link with `#viewer-container` does not appear to. I think it's possible that this is a javascript issue, as opposed to an issue with the text / anchor of the link.

dspace-development.title: Deliver Elements files to Digital Science via S3.

comments.body:
Requesting to list the contents from the Windows Server environment still seems to be unsuccessful (I receive the same error message). Within the SN@P ticket, I find the following:

> This request record will be closed now that it has been assessed for security concerns, and an individual change record has been submitted for each rule or host addition requested. The rules and host additions have NOT been implemented at this time. Each change request will go through its own approval (if necessary) and fulfillment

I am not certain why requesting traffic over the HTTPS for `cisdr201w` is problematic, my explanation was the following:

> Good Afternoon,
>
> This is to please request access for interacting with a dedicated AWS S3 Bucket for transferring files between the cisdr201w.princeton.edu host and Amazon Web Services.
>
> Thank you very much for your assistance and patience.
>
> Sincerely,
> James
I am currently trying to request that this be shared using the native Windows Server features for sharing a directory over the network.

The Windows Server indicates that this has been successful:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/171640062-ec82617f-b8db-4853-bd18-43d79fe948f0.png)

Attempting to connect to this network share from the bastion host (`lib200w`) was not successful:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/171640963-3e4d942b-a2b5-41de-ac2a-8eb1780fcdeb.png)

The server is available on the network:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/171641941-fc0bf60d-fccf-402a-ad80-908268ad487d.png)

I am extremely sorry, this was not the network firewall!

Apparently the Windows Firewall was disabled (along with the policies which were in place). I have just enabled this, and now outbound/inbound traffic behaves as expected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/171643448-cdd1f2aa-bb3e-42d1-9aee-11fb59d4f5b4.png)

I shall proceed accordingly.

This was also key to blocking traffic for the FTP server connections:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/171646357-0873a75b-8abf-49b2-855a-9b5cf077f9f6.png)

The vendor confirmed the ability to list contents but not download objects.  The IAM policy was adjusted and tested on our end successfully, and this should be resolved now; awaiting confirmation from the vendor.

lib_jobs.title: Data changed in the Alma person feed file

comments.body:
I went ahead and ran the person feed from the production server `` 

```
ssh deploy@lib-jobs-prod1
cd /opt/lib-jobs/current
bundle exec rails c
  people = AlmaPeople::OitPersonFeed.new
  json = people..get_json(begin_date: (Time.zone.now - 1.day).strftime("%Y-%m-%d"), end_date: 
  Time.zone.now.strftime("%Y-%m-%d"))
  json.map{|patron| [patron["PATRON_EXPIRATION_DATE"],patron["PVPATRONGROUP"]]}
```
You can see the expiration is nil for any patron group.

comments.body:
see https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/requests/9991807103506421?mfhd=22696270550006421

![Screen Shot 2022-06-02 at 8 46 39 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/171763249-8467b942-1856-417c-b65e-1498716bea7b.png)

This is in https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/ which retrieves availability from alma production. I made sure to index the record against catalog-qa so that we can see the example record. 
I haven't updated the status in JS yet but it can be done in a separate PR. 
This PR allows patrons to request the item using the request form.
Do we want the request form to display 'Firestone Stacks' or is it ok to display 'Resource Sharing'. The record page displays 'Firestone Stacks'.
closed by this PR. Thank you! https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/pull/3073
